techmeme.title: Reddit unveils Reddit Pro Trends, which allows companies to see what users are discussing about "virtually anything" on Reddit, and a new ad format for its AMAs (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
TikTok's sister app Lemon8 is sponsoring TikTok posts that encourage US users to migrate to Lemon8 as a TikTok ban looms; Lemon8 has TikTok account integrations (Axios)
The UK plans to make it a crime to create and share sexually explicit deepfakes; the UK criminalized revenge porn in 2015, but that law doesn't cover deepfakes (Catarina Demony/Reuters)
Razer unveils Project Ava, an "AI gaming copilot" that helps gamers by taking thousands of pictures of their screen and telling them how to play in real time (Sean Hollister/The Verge)
The US NHTSA says it has opened a probe into ~2.6M Tesla vehicles over reports of four reported crashes involving its "Actually Smart Summon" driverless feature (Reuters)
